ygData.subject: RE: Clarity and song/spell stacking
ygData.msgSnippet: Well the shaman I hang out with is 50th and his slow-down spell is most likely a 44 or 49th level spell. Let s just say it s is easily on par with a Mort
ygData.messageBody:
Well the shaman I hang out with is 50th and his slow-down spell is most
likely a 44 or 49th level spell. Let's just say it's is easily on par with a
Mort Fungus drowsy effect.

Sartori D'Elsiraad <The Companions>
Bard of Kelethin of the 50th chorus
Veeshan


>From: <kim@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Clarity and song/spell stacking
>Date: Wed, 17 Nov 1999 09:36:19 -0500 (EST)
>
>On Wed, 17 Nov 1999, Ryan Honeyman wrote:
> >
> > > I would assume that if Chords of Cessation's slowing effect is messing
>up a
> > > shaman's Yawn, the lvl 20 chords of melodic binding song may do the
>same?
> > > Again, haven't tested it.
> >
> > Constant Chains breaks the Shaman Drowsy line. Chains breaks any
> > vector movement effect AND any attack speed reduction effect, AFAIK.
> >
> > My tests were done on ice giants in everfrost, with a level 50 shaman
> > and myself.
>
>How much of a slowdown did the shaman spell have? I've been
>watching for this when an enchanter friend cast a slowdown on
>a mob we were fighting. Her spell was a much greater slowdown
>than Chain would've caused, and based on my eyeball
>observations (combat was too hectic to use a stopwatch) Chain
>didn't override the spell.
>
>--
>John H. Kim
>kim@...
>
